content: milanese lace topper by tante ehm pattern notes this hat is knit in the round the brim is simple stockinette then the milanese lace is worked every round blocking is essential for the lace to relax and the brim to lay flat finished measurements small 18 inches / 45 75 cm around 8 inches / 20 3 cm tall directions medium using circular needle co 90 96 102 sts pm and join to work in the round 19 2 inches / 48 75 cm around round 1 k1 p1 around 8 inches / 20 3 cm tall rnds 2 to 14 k large 20 4 inches / 51 8 cm around begin milanese lace 9 inches / 22 8 cm tall round 1 k4 k2tog yo around round 2 k3 k2tog k1 yo around gauge round 3 k2 k2tog k2 yo around 20 sts/28 row = 4 inches / 10 cm round 4 k1 k2tog k3 yo around in stockinette stitch round 5 k2tog k4 yo around remove marker slip_stitch pm materials work rnds 1-5 of lace pattern 8 8 9 times or until desired height 120 m - 142 yds / 110 - 130 m be sure to remove marker slip_stitch pm after working round 5 for the last time worsted weight yarn 1 set us 4 / 3 5 mm double pointed begin crown shaping needles switch to double pointed needles when there are too few sts to 1 16 inch / 40 cm us 4 / 3 5 mm comfortably work on the circular needle circular needle or size needed to obtain gauge round 1 k4 k2tog around 75 80 85 sts stitch marker round 2 k tapestry needle round 3 k3 k2tog around 60 64 68 sts round 4 k abbreviations round 5 k2 k2tog around 45 48 51 sts bobble bind off round 6 k co cast on round 7 k1 k2tog around 30 32 34 sts k knit round 8 k k2tog k two sts together round 9 k2tog around 15 16 17 sts p purl small round 10 k2tog k1 around 10 sts pm place marker medium round 10 k1 k2tog k1 around 11 sts round s round s large round 10 k2tog k1 to last two sts k2tog 11 sts sl slip st s stitch es cut yarn and draw the yarn tail through the remaining sts to secure yo yarn over block and weave in ends ©2011 tante ehm www ravelry com/designers/tante-ehm
